node.title: 'Use a different haka': Māori tribe tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using its heritage
node.description: A Māori tribe that claims New Zealand's most famous haka as its heritage tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using the traditional performance to promote their message.
node.content: ["A M\u0101ori tribe that claims New Zealand's most famous haka as its heritage has told anti-vaccine protesters to stop using the traditional performance to promote their message.", "Vaccine protesters have performed the Ka Mate, a M\u0101ori haka composed in about 1820 by Te Rauparaha, war leader of the Ng\u0101ti Toa tribe, at their rallies over the past few weeks against vaccine mandates and pandemic restrictions.", "\"We do not support their position and we do not want our tupuna [ancestors]\u00a0or our iwi [tribe] associated with their messages,\" the Ngati Toa tribe\u00a0said in a statement.", "\"Our message to protesters who wish to use Ka Mate is to use a different haka. We do not endorse the use of Ka Mate for this purpose.\"", "Although there are many forms of haka composed by different tribes for various uses and occasions, the Ka Mate\u00a0is the most widely known because it has been performed by the All Blacks at international rugby test matches for decades.", "It involves a fearsome display of rhythmic foot-stamping and chanting, eye-rolling and sticking tongues out.", "New Zealand, which has among the lowest rates of COVID-19 in the world, has struggled to fight off the highly infectious Delta variant of the coronavirus this year.\u00a0", "It has\u00a0forced\u00a0Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to move from a strategy of elimination through lockdowns to living with the virus with higher vaccinations.", "Ms Ardern has set a target of vaccinating 90 per cent\u00a0of those eligible before ending lockdowns.", "About 81 per cent\u00a0of the eligible population has received two vaccine doses but Ms Ardern said that health authorities were struggling to reach some young M\u0101ori due to misinformation about vaccines.", "\"So it's not just an access issue,' Ms Ardern said.", "As of November\u00a013, 76 per cent\u00a0of M\u0101ori people have received one dose of a vaccine while 60 per cent\u00a0were fully vaccinated.", "Authorities reported 173 new COVID-19 cases on Monday taking New Zealand's total number of infections to more than 8,500.", "Reuters"]
